items.title: Palworld and PUBG are getting dating sims
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Developers of Palworld and PUBG announced dating simulators set in their game universes.
- Palworld dating sim, titled 'Pal♡world! ~More Than Just Pals~', was preceded by a trailer and an official Steam listing, with a release date yet to be announced.
- Players in Palworld will interact with characters as friends or pursue romantic relationships.
- PUBG's dating sim, 'Winner Winner Romantic Dinner', is an April Fools' Day promotion featuring characters inspired by the game's weapons, available from April 1 to April 29.

items.title: Finally, an e-bike that charges off USB-C
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Ampler introduces the Nova and Nova Pro e-bikes with USB-C charging capability.
- Bikes can charge from 0 to full in about three hours using a USB-C PD 3.1 charger.
- Prices are €2,990 for the Nova and €3,490 for the Nova Pro, with preorders starting now and shipping in June.

items.title: OpenAI just raised another $40 billion round led by SoftBank
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- OpenAI raised $40 billion in a new funding round led by SoftBank, reaching a valuation of $300 billion.  
- Largest funding round for a private tech company in history, according to CNBC.  
- OpenAI will receive $10 billion initially, with $30 billion more contingent on becoming a for-profit by year’s end.  
- This funding follows OpenAI's Stargate project, a $500 billion venture for AI datacenters.  
- OpenAI recently gained 1 million users in one hour due to a new feature in ChatGPT.  
- Expected revenue jumps from $3.7 billion to $12.7 billion this year, but still not projected to be cash flow positive until 2029.  
- OpenAI aims to develop AGI that benefits all of humanity, requiring significant resources and funding.

items.title: The Space Race Heats Up: Latest Rocket Launches and News
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Andoya Spaceport's first orbital launch attempt lasted about 30 seconds before being aborted due to trajectory issues.
- NASA and Boeing are addressing in-flight anomalies of the Starliner spacecraft before its next flight, expected in 2026.
- Katy Perry will join others for Blue Origin's first all-female flight on April 14, 2025, aboard the New Shepard rocket.
- SpaceX Crew-9 and Boeing Starliner astronauts successfully returned to Earth after their respective missions.
- SpaceX's latest Starship flight test ended in failure as the rocket exploded during its eighth test flight.

items.title: Robot vacuums are getting upgraded support for Apple Home
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Apple's iOS 18.4 update includes support for robot vacuums in the Apple Home app via the Matter protocol.
- Companies like Roborock, iRobot, and Ecovacs are releasing firmware updates for enhanced compatibility.
- Notable Roborock models receiving updates include the S8 MaxV Ultra and Saros series, scheduled for firmware release between April 1st and 10th.
- iRobot's Roomba Combo 10 Max will be the first compliant with Matter and Apple Home, enabling control through the Home app and Siri.
- Ecovacs is rolling out Matter 1.4 firmware updates for models like Deebot X2 starting today, with phased availability.
- Original announcement for support of robot vacuums in Apple Home was made during WWDC 2024.

items.title: Microsoft expands AI features across Intel and AMD-powered Copilot Plus PCs
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Microsoft releases AI features on Copilot Plus PCs with Intel and AMD chips.
- Key feature: Live Captions translates audio to English subtitles in real time.
- Live Captions available from latest Windows 11 update.
- New tool Cocreator in Paint generates images based on text descriptions.
- Access to AI image editor and generator in the Photos app is expanded.
- Features were earlier limited to devices with Qualcomm chips.
- Ongoing testing of the Recall feature for searching screenshots from activities.

items.title: SwitchBot’s smart button pusher is 30 percent off for Amazon’s Big Spring Sale
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The SwitchBot Bot is on sale for $20.99 (originally $29.99) using promo code BKLP15 or $22.49 on Amazon.
- It automates devices with buttons, including garage doors, light switches, and appliances.
- Supports voice commands via Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, and Siri when paired with a SwitchBot hub.
- Does not work on toggle switches and requires a separate hub for remote control.
- The SwitchBot Hub Mini is also on sale for $27.99.

items.title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals you can still grab for under $30
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon’s Big Spring Sale runs until March 31, 2025, offering deals without a Prime membership requirement.
- Featured products include:
  - [JLab Bluetooth earbuds](https://www.amazon.com/JLab-Bluetooth-Resistance-Connection-Signature/dp/B0CXGXT6W8?tag=theverge02-20) for a budget-friendly price.
  - [Baseus retractable USB-C charger](https://www.amazon.com/Baseus-Retractable-Charging-7-Stage-Charger/dp/B0C858GPF9/?tag=theverge02-20) priced at $10.
  - [Anker USB-C Hub](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07ZVKTP53?th=1&tag=theverge02-20) selling for $25.
  - [Soundcore Bluetooth speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DB1753RZ/?tag=theverge02-20) at $20.
  - A variety of tech accessories and gadgets are highlighted as great low-cost deals available now.

items.title: iOS 18.4 is out now with Apple Intelligence-powered priority notifications
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- iOS 18.4 introduces priority notifications utilizing Apple Intelligence to highlight important alerts.
- Notifications are prioritized and appear at the top of the notification stack on the Home Screen.
- The update expands Apple Intelligence language support to French, German, Italian, Portuguese (Brazil), Spanish, Japanese, Korean, Chinese (simplified), as well as localized English for Singapore and India.
- Available now on Vision Pro as part of visionOS 2.4, introducing a Vision Pro app for iOS to assist users in finding headset content.
- Additional features include a recipes section for News Plus subscribers and several enhancements to Photos.

items.title: Plex is rolling out its big app redesign
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Plex is rolling out its redesigned mobile app to Android and iOS devices within a week.
- The new app features an updated navigation system, a Watchlist button, and improved artwork for shows and movies.
- Improvements include faster load times, scrolling, a sleep timer, and picture-in-picture support.
- Future updates will allow downloading entire seasons, casting to more devices, and revised UI for ratings and reviews.
- Plex is also increasing the Plex Pass subscription price to $6.99 starting April 29th, with remote playback now requiring a subscription.

items.title: Amazon’s new AI agent is designed to do your shopping
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Amazon has launched a new AI model, **Nova Act**, for online shopping tasks in the browser, currently available in a research preview for developers.
- Nova Act can perform web searches, make purchases, and execute detailed instructions, such as avoiding upsells during a transaction.
- This model is part of Amazon's **Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) Labs**, which aims to enable agents to manage complex tasks, with the aspiration of enhancing business productivity.
- Nova Act is the first product released following the announcement of five Nova models in December 2024, focusing on speed and cost-effectiveness compared to competitors.
- Amazon is also providing easier access to their AI models through a new website for developers, who previously accessed them via Amazon Bedrock.

items.title: Alexa Plus just launched in early access, but it’s missing some features
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Amazon has launched its AI-powered **Alexa Plus** in early access for a limited number of customers.
- The service lacks some advertised features such as budgeting gift ideas and grocery ordering.
- Currently available only on **Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21** devices, with capabilities like ordering Uber and document summarization.
- **Alexa Plus** subscription costs **$19.99 per month**, also free for Prime members.
- Features are expected to be launched in waves over time, with ongoing improvements planned.

items.title: Max’s rebranded logo and colors look very HBO
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Max introduces a new black-and-white logo and branding that recalls HBO’s classic style.
- The change aligns the streaming service, previously bright blue, more closely with HBO's iconic image.
- This rebranding follows the announcement of Max's availability in Australia.
- The new visual identity will be rolled out over the next few months across various platforms.
- The service was previously rebranded from HBO Max to Max after the merger of HBO Max and Discovery Plus in 2023.

items.title: Amazon’s Big Spring Sale Ending Soon: Last Chance for Discounts
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The Big Spring Sale on Amazon is concluding tonight, March 31, 2025.
- Major discounts on tech products available, potentially not seen until Prime Day.
- Featured deals include video doorbells, headphones, smartwatches, air purifiers, and more.
- Prime membership generally ensures quicker shipping, but many deals are accessible to non-members.
- Competing retailers like Best Buy, Walmart, and Target are also being monitored for deals.
- Notable featured deals involve high-quality products such as Anker chargers, Hoto screwdrivers, Apple AirPods Pro, LG OLED TVs, and more.

items.title: Want to feel like a spy? Stick a smart chip in your manicure
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Jakcom N3 Smart Nail Chip uses NFC technology to allow users to send data to their phone by tapping it to the nail.
- It is inexpensive, with prices ranging around $20 for sets of chips.
- Users can program the chip to link to social media, e-commerce, and other functions, though the data storage interface is described as confusing.
- The chip's application can be challenging; it requires precise placement and may not be durable in wet conditions.
- After several trials, the best placement was found to be under the edge of medium-to-long press-on nails for optimal scanning.
- Using Apple’s Shortcuts app expands the chip's functions significantly, allowing automation like sending messages or performing tasks with a quick scan.

items.title: CEO Matt Bromberg on ending Unity’s ‘war’ against its customers
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Matt Bromberg, CEO of Unity, discusses changes he implemented after joining the company amid customer dissatisfaction and turmoil.
- Bromberg highlights the importance of Unity in the gaming ecosystem, powering many mobile and independent games.
- The previous pricing model change, known as the runtime fee, led to severe backlash and the resignation of the former CEO, John Riccitiello.
- Bromberg chose to scrap the runtime fee, seeing it as crucial for Unity's future success.
- He talks about Unity's current focus and growth opportunities outside gaming, including applications in automotive and other industries.

items.title: Coyote vs. Acme is getting its day in theaters
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery sells global distribution rights of *Coyote vs. Acme* to Ketchup Entertainment for approximately $50 million.
- Ketchup plans to release the film, directed by Dave Green, in theaters in 2026.
- The film had been shelved in 2023 for a $30 million tax write-off; Warner Bros. had rejected other offers from Amazon, Netflix, and Paramount.
- Ketchup’s CEO expresses excitement about the film's blend of nostalgia and modern storytelling.

items.title: The 1TB Xbox Series X expansion card is back down to its lowest price ever
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The 1TB WD Black C50 expansion card is discounted by 26% to $109.99, down from a typical price of around $150.
- This sale coincides with World Backup Day and Amazon’s Big Spring Sale.
- The card is suitable for Xbox Series X/S consoles and ensures faster game load times and ample storage space for large game files like Grand Theft Auto VI.

items.title: Apple fined $162 million for hurting app developers with ‘excessively complex’ privacy options
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- France's competition watchdog fined Apple €150 million (~$162.4 million) for its App Tracking Transparency system, which was deemed harmful to small publishers.
- The system, launched in 2021, requires two pop-ups for user tracking permission, while location tracking for Apple's apps requires only one tap.
- The French authority argues the initiative makes third-party app usage excessively complex compared to Apple apps, impacting revenue for companies like Snapchat and Facebook by nearly $10 billion.

items.title: TikTok, tariffs, and trials: everything happening in tech’s chaotic April
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- TikTok's deadline for a potential ban is April 5th, with uncertainty surrounding its sale from ByteDance.
- As of April 2nd, Trump has postponed tariffs on auto imports and proposed various tariffs on goods from Venezuela, European wine, and Canada.
- The FTC v. Meta trial starts on April 14th, examining whether Meta has monopolized social networking.
- On April 22nd, a trial will begin regarding Google’s monopolization of the online search market with discussions on potential remedies.

items.title: The 50 best things Microsoft has ever made
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Microsoft celebrates its 50th anniversary on April 4th, 2023.
- The Verge curated a list of the 50 best products made by Microsoft over the decades.
- Criteria included products that were consumer-facing or directly used by consumers.
- Notable mentions include Clippy (Office Assistant), Microsoft Bob, the fictional company Contoso, and Metro design language.
- The list evaluates both successful and infamous products that shaped the company's legacy in technology.

items.title: The Verge’s favorite stuff with style
items.author: Verge Staff

items.title: Elon Musk and Taylor Swift can now hide details of their private jets
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Private aircraft owners can request the FAA to keep their registration details private.
- This change impacts celebrity jet trackers who previously used public information to track jets owned by figures like Elon Musk and Taylor Swift.
- The new FAA system was mandated by the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, signed into law in May 2024.
- The FAA is considering making the default position to keep such information private, potentially complicating the tracking of celebrity flights.

items.title: When will physical video games go away?
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Physical game sales decreased to less than half of 2021 levels in 2024.
- The market has been declining since 2008 due to a shift towards digital games and online connectivity.
- Microsoft has introduced all-digital consoles, indicating a future without discs by the end of the decade.
- Sony is also moving towards digital, but may take longer due to their larger install base of physical game players.
- Nintendo continues to support physical games with the Switch 2, but is implementing a digital lending system for games as well.
- Sales of physical game accessories are rising, indicating a shift in focus from physical games to physical gaming experiences.

items.title: Microsoft is redesigning the Windows BSOD and it might change to black
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is overhauling the Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) for Windows 11, changing its color from blue to black.
- The new design will feature a more streamlined user interface without the traditional blue color, frowning face, or QR code.
- The BSOD now states, "your device ran into a problem and needs to restart," while preserving technical information.
- Windows Insiders can test the new BSOD, which initially appears as a green screen in beta versions before adoption as a black screen.
- This marks the first significant change since the sad face was introduced in Windows 8. 
- The new BSOD design is expected to roll out to the existing Windows 11 version 24H2 soon.

items.title: Movie studios are being financially rewarded for AI slop on YouTube
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
• Some Hollywood studios are profiting from AI-generated fake movie trailers on YouTube.
• Warner Bros. Discovery, Paramount, and Sony Pictures redirected ad revenue instead of enforcing copyright protections.
• The SAG-AFTRA union criticized these studios for exploiting actors' likenesses without permission.
• YouTube is flooded with AI-generated content, making it easier for users to create fake trailers.
• Screen Culture has 1.4 million subscribers, while KH Studio has 683,000, both monetizing AI content.
• YouTube suspended these accounts from its monetization program for violating policies against duplicative content.
• The accounts are appealing the decision; they've started rebranding their videos as “concept trailers.”
• SAG-AFTRA emphasizes the need for studios to protect actors’ rights and IP in the age of AI.

items.title: Nintendo has moved beyond specs
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The unveiling of the Switch 2 was brief with no price or release details provided.
- Nintendo has shifted focus away from technical specifications to player experience since the Wii.
- The Wii and DS achieved significant sales despite not being the most technically advanced.
- The philosophy centers on broadening the market rather than competing in a tech arms race.
- The Switch's success highlights Nintendo's approach, selling over 100 million units despite its lower specs compared to competitors.
- Specs are deemed secondary to the user experience with the upcoming Switch 2.

items.title: Galaxy Z Flip 7 FE looks just like last year’s flagship
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- The Galaxy Z Flip 7 FE will feature the same design as the Galaxy Z Flip 5 and 6, with a thick bezel on its cover screen.
- It is expected to have a 3.4-inch cover screen, unchanged from the previous model.
- The phone dimensions when unfolded are approximately 165.1 x 71.7 x 7.4mm, similar to last year’s model but slightly thicker.
- Samsung plans to announce its foldable phones during a Galaxy Unpacked event in July 2025.

items.title: The 50 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $100
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Best gadgets under $100 featured, including the Fitbit Inspire 3 and latest AirPods.
- Discounts available in Amazon's Big Spring Sale, highlighted budget-friendly picks.
- Products selected aim to balance quality with affordability, available without Amazon Prime subscription.
- Deals include earbud options like Nothing’s Ear (a) for $78 and Beats Studio Buds Plus for $100.
- Various tech categories covered, focusing on headphones, Bluetooth speakers, and charging accessories.

items.title: Ghosts in the Kinect
items.author: Geoffrey Bunting
items.summary:
- Ghost hunters Billy Tolley and Zak Bagans use the Kinect to detect invisible anomalies.
- The Kinect, discontinued in 2017, is popular among ghost hunters for its ability to create skeletal representations from depth data.
- Critics mention that the Kinect often misinterprets data, displaying human-like figures where none exist.
- Ghost hunting relies on ambiguous results, with many enthusiasts drawn to devices that provide suggestive evidence, even if erroneous.
- Despite its flaws, the Kinect remains a favored tool in paranormal investigation due to its historical significance and abilities, even if it doesn’t actually prove the existence of ghosts.

items.title: Apple TV Plus is on a hot streak
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Apple TV Plus releases a new comedy show titled [The Studio](https://www.themoviedb.org/tv/247767-the-studio?language=en-US) featuring Seth Rogen.
- Despite claims of low viewership, the platform continues to produce high-quality content.
- The newsletter also highlights new features in [Images in ChatGPT](https://help.openai.com/en/articles/8932459-creating-images-in-chatgpt) and the launch of the [Twelve South AirFly Pro 2](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.twelvesouth.com%2Fproducts%2Fairfly-pro-2) accessory for Bluetooth headphones.
- Other recommended content includes a nostalgic piece on fax machines, [Vivaldi browser with built-in VPN](https://vivaldi.com/blog/privacy-without-compromise-proton-vpn-is-now-built-into-vivaldi/), and [Side Quest](https://www.themoviedb.org/tv/216412-side-quest) from Apple TV Plus.

items.title: We went to 10 anti-Tesla protests — and a couple counter protests, too
items.author: The Verge
items.summary:
- Thousands protested against Tesla on March 29, targeting its locations worldwide, alongside counter-protests in support of Elon Musk.
- Protests began nearly two months ago, linked to opposition against Musk's actions with DOGE and cuts to humanitarian aid.
- Key cities for protests included London, Washington DC, Paramus, NJ, and Akron, OH, showcasing a mixture of messages, themes, and engagement with passersby.
- Protest slogans varied widely, from criticizing Musk to supporting broader political views, indicative of the protestors' motivations and demographics.
- Despite significant protests, Tesla's sales have reportedly declined, though Musk continues to assert his stance against the opposition.

items.title: Samsung’s latest stick vac can alert you to calls and text messages
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Samsung introduces the Bespoke AI Jet Ultra cordless stick vac that alerts users to phone calls and text messages via its LCD display.
- The vacuum boasts 400 AW suction power and has a 100-minute battery life, priced at $1,099.
- Samsung's AI Home technology allows control over home appliances with 7- or 9-inch touchscreens.
- Includes features like auto detergent dispensing and cycle completion notifications in the Bespoke AI Laundry Vented Combo washer/dryer, priced at $3,099.
- Samsung's appliances require a Samsung account and SmartThings app for full functionality, including integration with Android and iOS devices.

items.title: Amazon Spring Sale: Verge Staff Favorites on Tech Deals
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- The Verge staff shares favorite items now discounted for Amazon's Spring Sale.
- Featured items include:
  - [Automatic Soap Dispenser](https://www.amazon.com/Automatic-Soap-Dispenser-Rechargeable-Adjustable/dp/B0C82VLHW3/?tag=theverge02-20) - $19, a hands-free option for easier kitchen use.
  - [Instant Pot](https://www.amazon.com/Instant-Pot-Multi-Use-Pressure-Cooker/dp/B08WCLJ7JG/?tag=theverge02-20) - $100, an 11-in-1 appliance ideal for quick cooking.
  - [Food Chopper](https://www.amazon.com/Chopper-Vegetable-Durable-Material-Cup-Gray/dp/B097CW44Q5/?tag=theverge02-20) - $11, highly efficient for chopping vegetables swiftly.
  - [Yogasleep Hushh](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01D50RYSC/?tag=theverge02-20) - $24, a portable white noise machine for infants.
  - [GraviTrax Starter Set](https://www.amazon.com/Ravensburger-Starter-Set-Kugelbahnsystem-Konstruktionsspielzeug-Produktlinien/dp/B0BSXKTRYZ/?tag=theverge02-20) - $49, an interactive building toy for kids.
  - [Snoo Smart Sleeper](https://www.amazon.com/SNOO-Smart-Sleeper-Happiest-Baby/dp/B0716KN18Z/?tag=theverge02-20) - $1187, a bassinet designed to soothe babies with motion and white noise.
  - [Gouevn Soil Moisture Meter](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07RDDLCBJ/?tag=theverge02-20) - $8, helps manage plant watering.
  - [Velcro Garden Ties](https://www.amazon.com/VELCRO-Brand-Adjustable-Gardens-Gardening/dp/B005755YSQ/?tag=theverge02-20) - $6, used for securing plants.

items.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows lives up to the series’ name
items.author: Tauriq Moosa
items.summary:
- Assassin’s Creed Shadows features refined stealth and assassination mechanics unlike previous titles in the franchise.
- The game’s mechanics evoke a blend of action and strategy, requiring players to use planning and a variety of skills.
- Players can recruit allies with unique abilities to assist in completing missions, enhancing gameplay variety.
- The character Naoe can employ magical skills, such as slowing time, to execute precise assassinations.
- The game emphasizes stealth and cleverness in gameplay, diverging from the action-heavy style of recent Assassin’s Creed titles.

items.title: Mixed Impressions on the New Razer Blade 16 Gaming Laptop
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- The Razer Blade 16 aims to be a gaming alternative to the MacBook Pro, featuring a thinner and lighter design.  
- It is equipped with an Nvidia RTX 5090 GPU, priced at $4,499.99, which is $200 more than the previous 4090 model.  
- The reviewer experienced hardware issues with the initial unit, leading to a replacement, which still faced random bluescreen crashes.  
- The laptop features a 16-inch OLED display (2560 x 1600) with a 240Hz refresh rate and good keyboard quality, though the new macro key placement poses usability problems.  
- Although the design is improved, thermal performance needs further testing. Razer’s Cooling Pad may provide additional performance but adds cost and noise.  
- The RTX 5090 shows about 20% more efficiency compared to the 4090, but the reviewer found battery performance disappointing under light workloads, struggling to last a full workday.  
- Overall, while the laptop has attractive features for gaming and productivity, its high price and technical reliability issues raise concerns for potential buyers.

items.title: BougeRV’s telescopic lantern is ridiculously versatile
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
[The BougeRV Outdoor Portable Telescopic Camping Lantern](https://www.theverge.com/reviews/638090/bougerv-flextail-telescopic-lantern-review-price) is marketed as an outdoor camplight but is versatile enough for various uses.
- Features three swiveling LED panels producing 3000 lumens, extendable to over five feet in height.
- Offers warm or cold light with three brightness levels and can last up to 60 hours at low brightness.
- Priced at $109.99, it competes well against higher-priced, less capable products.
- Built with a 57.7Wh battery, USB-C charging, and IP54 rating for durability against water and dust.
- Notable for its portability despite weighing 2.3 pounds and its compact design when not extended.
- Critique includes concerns about durability over multiple falls and lack of a magnetic base.

items.title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- A court granted a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration from dismantling the CFPB while the case is decided.
- Judge Amy Berman Jackson expressed concerns about the risk of destruction of the agency and stated that it would be impossible to rebuild.
- The ruling is a significant victory for the federal workers' union and groups dependent on the CFPB's protections.
- The Trump administration's actions are alleged to violate constitutional separation of powers and have left consumers without adequate financial recourse.
- The judge criticized the government's inconsistent statements about the status of CFPB workers and was not confident in their trustworthiness.
- The CFPB is ordered to reinstate terminated employees and maintain agency data, allowing them to continue operations for the time being.

items.title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Microsoft is removing the bypassnro.cmd script in Windows 11 Insider Preview to enforce Microsoft account login during setup.
- This is aimed at increasing security and ensuring all users have internet connectivity during the setup process.
- Current workarounds, like registry edits or unattended.xml automation, may not be viable for long as Microsoft tightens restrictions on installations and upgrades to Windows 11.

items.title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Elon Musk's AI company xAI has acquired the social media platform X in an all-stock deal valued at $33 billion.
- The transaction also values xAI at $80 billion, including $12 billion in debt from Musk's earlier acquisition of Twitter.
- Musk has emphasized the integration of xAI's capabilities with X, claiming it will enhance data access and business growth.

items.title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Microsoft introduces the Quick Machine Recovery feature to help restore PCs that fail to boot.
- This initiative aims to prevent widespread outages similar to those caused by a previous Crowdstrike update.
- The feature was announced on March 28, 2025.

items.title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate to a Google account to February 2, 2026.
- Users will lose access to Fitbit services and historical data after the migration deadline unless they transition to a Google account.
- Fitbit users have the option to download or delete their data before the deadline.

items.title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The Metals Company (TMC) seeks to initiate deep-sea mining, potentially with U.S. support under Trump administration.
- In 2021, Nauru sponsored TMC, pushing for regulations to allow mining of ocean minerals for batteries.
- Environmental concerns arise regarding the impact on ocean ecosystems and coastal communities.
- TMC plans to apply for U.S. permits, claiming to comply with international law despite critics' objections.
- Critics, including Greenpeace and Deep Sea Conservation Coalition, oppose mining efforts without adequate regulations.
- Recent scientific studies highlight potential risks of deep-sea mining, including threats to marine life and ecosystems.

items.title: MrBeast co-wrote a book with James Patterson
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- MrBeast co-wrote a thriller novel with James Patterson, author of the Alex Cross series.
- The book, which is untitled, has attracted eight-figure bids for its publishing rights.
- The plot involves players fighting to survive deadly tests in dangerous locations worldwide, similar to the concept of Squid Game.
- MrBeast has incorporated Squid Game-like themes in his viral YouTube videos and recently launched the reality show Beast Games, featuring a $5 million prize.
- Film and TV rights to the novel are reportedly being negotiated.

items.title: Lenovo’s upcoming SteamOS handheld will cost $50 more than expected
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The SteamOS-powered Lenovo Legion Go S handheld was announced at CES 2025 with an initial price of $499.99.
- The pre-order price is now $549.99, confirmed by Lenovo’s communications director.
- Features include Hall effect joysticks, an 8-inch screen with variable refresh rate, but performance is not impressive compared to the Steam Deck.

items.title: Side Quest’s creators wanted to tell stories about why people love games
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Apple TV Plus’ new miniseries, *Side Quest*, is a spinoff of *Mythic Quest*, focusing on players’ stories rather than creators.
- Co-creators Ashly Burch, John Howell Harris, and Katie McElhenney aim to explore relationships with popular games through different character perspectives.
- The series consists of four episodes, with a theme resembling the earlier *Mythic Quest* episode “A Dark Quiet Death.”
- The episode “The Last Raid” reflects on real-world friendships and gaming experiences, inspired by classic machinima like *Red vs. Blue*.
- All episodes of *Side Quest* are available for streaming on Apple TV Plus.

items.title: ChatGPT’s Ghibli filter is political now, but it always was
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- The White House used AI-generated images in a controversial post featuring a crying detainee, linking it with ChatGPT's Ghibli filter.
- The incident reflects a troubling intertwining of generative AI technology and political messaging, particularly amidst Trump's administration.
- OpenAI's Ghibli filter raises ethical concerns as it appropriates the style of renowned filmmaker Hayao Miyazaki, who opposes AI-generated art.

items.title: YouTube tests turning off notifications for channels you don't watch
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- YouTube is testing disabling push notifications for frequently updating channels that users don't open notifications for.
- The test specifically targets channels users have notifications set to "all." Notifications for less active channels will remain unaffected.
- There is uncertainty if users will be notified about missed alerts, with concerns over platform control of user notifications.
- The test is described as a small experiment with no details on duration or potential wider rollout.

items.title: Google to pay $100 million to settle 14-year-old advertising lawsuit
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google will pay $100 million to settle a class action lawsuit regarding misleading ad charges.
- The lawsuit, filed in 2011, alleged Google charged for clicks on ads placed outside specified geographical locations.
- The settlement requires court approval and includes advertisers who used Google Ads between June 1, 2009, and December 13, 2012.
- The case involved reviewing over 910,000 pages of documents and extensive data from Google.
- Google faced other legal challenges including federal antitrust lawsuits concerning its advertising practices.

items.title: Musk threatens to sic the government on people ‘pushing’ Tesla ‘propaganda’
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Elon Musk threatens to target individuals he views as spreading negative propaganda about Tesla amid rising protests against the company.
- The protests, labeled "Tesla Takedown," reflect opposition to Musk's political actions and policies, leading to large demonstrations at Tesla locations across the U.S.
- Musk expressed concerns about the impact of propaganda from the far left on those arrested for vandalism against Tesla properties, creating ambiguity about the treatment of peaceful protesters.
